page.title: 01Balnahard & The North End
page.content: This northerly part of Colonsay is cut from the island by the high ground of Carnan Eoin but is one of best fertile small farms. Only 3 inhabitants famous for seabirds. The Golden Eagles nest Burnetts Roas in the sand dunes and its historical sites. Very few trees - less than a dozen in whole area the main features are rocks and the beautifully built dry-stone walls apart from arable, ground is rocky, or heather and bracken covered. With some areas of bog myrtle and machair round the bay area. The west coast though full of difficult reefs is good lobster and crab ground and from sgibinis to the north point (Eilean Dubh) flotsam and jetsom are to be found in every bay.
